functions.name: GetDC
functions.description: The GetDC function retrieves a handle to a device context (DC) for the client area of a specified window or for the entire screen. You can use the returned handle in subsequent GDI functions to draw in the DC. The device context is an opaque data structure, whose values are used internally by GDI.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window whose DC is to be retrieved. If this value is NULL, GetDC retrieves the DC for the entire screen.

functions.name: GetDCEx
functions.description: The GetDCEx function retrieves a handle to a device context (DC) for the client area of a specified window or for the entire screen. You can use the returned handle in subsequent GDI functions to draw in the DC. The device context is an opaque data structure, whose values are used internally by GDI.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window whose DC is to be retrieved. If this value is NULL, GetDCEx retrieves the DC for the entire screen.

parameters.name: hrgnClip
parameters.description: A clipping region that may be combined with the visible region of the DC. If the value of flags is DCX_INTERSECTRGN or DCX_EXCLUDERGN, then the operating system assumes ownership of the region and will automatically delete it when it is no longer needed. In this case, the application should not use or delete the region after a successful call to GetDCEx.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: Specifies how the DC is created. This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

functions.name: GetDialogBaseUnits

For dialog boxes that use the system font, you can use these values to convert between dialog template units, as specified in dialog box templates, and pixels. For dialog boxes that do not use the system font, the conversion from dialog template units to pixels depends on the font used by the dialog box.

parameters.description: Indicates success or failure (TRUE indicates success, FALSE indicates failure).

functions.name: GetDlgItemTextA
functions.description: Retrieves the title or text associated with a control in a dialog box.

parameters.name: hDlg
parameters.description: A handle to the dialog box that contains the control.

parameters.name: nIDDlgItem
parameters.description: The identifier of the control whose title or text is to be retrieved.

parameters.name: lpString
parameters.description: The buffer to receive the title or text.

parameters.name: cchMax
parameters.description: The maximum length, in characters, of the string to be copied to the buffer pointed to by lpString. If the length of the string, including the null character, exceeds the limit, the string is truncated.

functions.name: GetDlgItemTextW
functions.description: Retrieves the title or text associated with a control in a dialog box.

parameters.name: hDlg
parameters.description: A handle to the dialog box that contains the control.

parameters.name: nIDDlgItem
parameters.description: The identifier of the control whose title or text is to be retrieved.

parameters.name: lpString
parameters.description: The buffer to receive the title or text.

parameters.name: cchMax
parameters.description: The maximum length, in characters, of the string to be copied to the buffer pointed to by lpString. If the length of the string, including the null character, exceeds the limit, the string is truncated.

functions.name: GetDoubleClickTime
functions.description: Retrieves the current double-click time for the mouse. A double-click is a series of two clicks of the mouse button, the second occurring within a specified time after the first. The double-click time is the maximum number of milliseconds that may occur between the first and second click of a double-click. The maximum double-click time is 5000 milliseconds.

functions.name: GetDpiForSystem
functions.description: Returns the system DPI.

functions.name: GetDpiForWindow
functions.description: Returns the dots per inch (dpi) value for the associated window.

parameters.name: hwnd
parameters.description: The window you want to get information about.

functions.name: GetDpiFromDpiAwarenessContext
functions.description: Retrieves the DPI from a given DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT handle. This enables you to determine the DPI of a thread without needed to examine a window created within that thread.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT handle to examine.

functions.name: GetFocus
functions.description: Retrieves the handle to the window that has the keyboard focus, if the window is attached to the calling thread's message queue.

functions.name: GetForegroundWindow
functions.description: Retrieves a handle to the foreground window (the window with which the user is currently working). The system assigns a slightly higher priority to the thread that creates the foreground window than it does to other threads.

functions.name: GetGestureConfig
functions.description: Retrieves the configuration for which Windows  Touch gesture messages are sent from a window.

parameters.name: hwnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window to get the gesture configuration from.

parameters.name: dwReserved
parameters.description: This value is reserved and must be set to 0.

parameters.name: dwFlags
parameters.description: A gesture command flag value indicating options for retrieving the gesture configuration.  See Remarks for additional information and supported values.

parameters.name: pcIDs
parameters.description: The size, in number of gesture configuration structures, that is in the pGestureConfig buffer.

parameters.name: pGestureConfig
parameters.description: An array of gesture configuration structures that specify the gesture configuration.

parameters.name: cbSize
parameters.description: The size of the gesture configuration (GESTURECONFIG) structure.

functions.name: GetGestureExtraArgs
functions.description: Retrieves additional information about a gesture from its GESTUREINFO handle.

parameters.name: hGestureInfo
parameters.description: The handle to the gesture information that is passed in the lParam of a WM_GESTURE message.

parameters.name: cbExtraArgs
parameters.description: A count of the bytes of data stored in the extra arguments.

parameters.name: pExtraArgs
parameters.description: A pointer to the extra argument information.

functions.name: GetGestureInfo
functions.description:
Retrieves a GESTUREINFO  structure given a handle to
the gesture information.

parameters.name: hGestureInfo
parameters.description: The gesture information handle.

parameters.name: pGestureInfo
parameters.description: A pointer to the gesture information structure.

functions.name: GetGuiResources
functions.description: Retrieves the count of handles to graphical user interface (GUI) objects in use by the specified process.

parameters.name: hProcess
parameters.description: A handle to the process. The handle must refer to a process in the current session, and must have the PROCESS_QUERY_INFORMATION access right (see Process security and access rights).

functions.name: GetGUIThreadInfo
functions.description: Retrieves information about the active window or a specified GUI thread.

parameters.name: idThread
parameters.description: The identifier for the thread for which information is to be retrieved. To retrieve this value, use the GetWindowThreadProcessId function. If this parameter is NULL, the function returns information for the foreground thread.

parameters.name: pgui
parameters.description: A pointer to a GUITHREADINFO structure that receives information describing the thread. Note that you must set the cbSize member to sizeof(GUITHREADINFO) before calling this function.

functions.name: GetIconInfo
functions.description: Retrieves information about the specified icon or cursor.

parameters.name: hIcon
parameters.description: A handle to the icon or cursor. To retrieve information about a standard icon or cursor, specify one of the following values.

parameters.name: piconinfo
parameters.description: A pointer to an ICONINFO structure. The function fills in the structure's members.

functions.name: GetIconInfoExA
functions.description: Retrieves information about the specified icon or cursor. GetIconInfoEx extends GetIconInfo by using the newer ICONINFOEX structure.

parameters.name: hicon
parameters.description: A handle to the icon or cursor. To retrieve information about a standard icon or cursor, specify one of the following values.

parameters.name: piconinfo
parameters.description: When this method returns, contains a pointer to an ICONINFOEX structure. The function fills in the structure's members.

functions.name: GetIconInfoExW
functions.description: Retrieves information about the specified icon or cursor. GetIconInfoEx extends GetIconInfo by using the newer ICONINFOEX structure.

parameters.name: hicon
parameters.description: A handle to the icon or cursor. To retrieve information about a standard icon or cursor, specify one of the following values.

parameters.name: piconinfo
parameters.description: When this method returns, contains a pointer to an ICONINFOEX structure. The function fills in the structure's members.

functions.name: GetInputState
functions.description: Determines whether there are mouse-button or keyboard messages in the calling thread's message queue.

functions.name: GetKBCodePage
functions.description: Retrieves the current code page.

functions.name: GetKeyboardLayout
functions.description: Retrieves the active input locale identifier (formerly called the keyboard layout).

parameters.name: idThread
parameters.description: The identifier of the thread to query, or 0 for the current thread.

functions.name: GetKeyboardLayoutList
functions.description: Retrieves the input locale identifiers (formerly called keyboard layout handles) corresponding to the current set of input locales in the system. The function copies the identifiers to the specified buffer.

parameters.name: nBuff
parameters.description: The maximum number of handles that the buffer can hold.

parameters.name: lpList
parameters.description: A pointer to the buffer that receives the array of input locale identifiers.

functions.name: GetKeyboardLayoutNameA
functions.description: Retrieves the name of the active input locale identifier (formerly called the keyboard layout) for the system.

parameters.name: pwszKLID
parameters.description: The buffer (of at least KL_NAMELENGTH characters in length) that receives the name of the input locale identifier, including the terminating null character. This will be a copy of the string provided to the LoadKeyboardLayout function, unless layout substitution took place.

functions.name: GetKeyboardLayoutNameW
functions.description: Retrieves the name of the active input locale identifier (formerly called the keyboard layout) for the system.

parameters.name: pwszKLID
parameters.description: The buffer (of at least KL_NAMELENGTH characters in length) that receives the name of the input locale identifier, including the terminating null character. This will be a copy of the string provided to the LoadKeyboardLayout function, unless layout substitution took place.

functions.name: GetKeyboardState
functions.description: Copies the status of the 256 virtual keys to the specified buffer.

parameters.name: lpKeyState
parameters.description: The 256-byte array that receives the status data for each virtual key.

functions.name: GetKeyboardType
functions.description: Retrieves information about the current keyboard.

parameters.name: nTypeFlag
parameters.description: The type of keyboard information to be retrieved. This parameter can be one of the following values.

functions.name: GetKeyNameTextA
functions.description: Retrieves a string that represents the name of a key.

parameters.name: lParam
parameters.description:
The second parameter of the keyboard message (such as
WM_KEYDOWN) to be processed. The function interprets the following bit positions in the lParam.

parameters.name: lpString
parameters.description: The buffer that will receive the key name.

parameters.name: cchSize
parameters.description:
The maximum length, in characters, of the key name, including the terminating null character. (This parameter should be equal to the size of the buffer pointed to by the
lpString parameter.)

functions.name: GetKeyNameTextW
functions.description: Retrieves a string that represents the name of a key.

parameters.name: lParam
parameters.description:
The second parameter of the keyboard message (such as
WM_KEYDOWN) to be processed. The function interprets the following bit positions in the lParam.

parameters.name: lpString
parameters.description: The buffer that will receive the key name.

parameters.name: cchSize
parameters.description:
The maximum length, in characters, of the key name, including the terminating null character. (This parameter should be equal to the size of the buffer pointed to by the
lpString parameter.)

functions.name: GetKeyState
functions.description: Retrieves the status of the specified virtual key. The status specifies whether the key is up, down, or toggled (on, offâalternating each time the key is pressed).

parameters.name: nVirtKey
parameters.description:
A virtual key. If the desired virtual key is a letter or digit (A through Z, a through z, or 0 through 9),
nVirtKey must be set to the ASCII value of that character. For other keys, it must be a virtual-key code.

functions.name: GetLastActivePopup
functions.description: Determines which pop-up window owned by the specified window was most recently active.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the owner window.

functions.name: GetLastInputInfo
functions.description: Retrieves the time of the last input event.

parameters.name: plii
parameters.description: A pointer to a LASTINPUTINFO structure that receives the time of the last input event.

functions.name: GetLayeredWindowAttributes
functions.description: Retrieves the opacity and transparency color key of a layered window.

parameters.name: hwnd
parameters.description: A handle to the layered window. A layered window is created by specifying WS_EX_LAYERED when creating the window with the CreateWindowEx function or by setting WS_EX_LAYERED using SetWindowLong after the window has been created.

parameters.name: pcrKey
parameters.description: A pointer to a COLORREF value that receives the transparency color key to be used when composing the layered window. All pixels painted by the window in this color will be transparent. This can be NULL if the argument is not needed.

parameters.name: pbAlpha
parameters.description: The Alpha value used to describe the opacity of the layered window. Similar to the SourceConstantAlpha member of the BLENDFUNCTION structure. When the variable referred to by pbAlpha is 0, the window is completely transparent. When the variable referred to by pbAlpha is 255, the window is opaque. This can be NULL if the argument is not needed.

parameters.name: pdwFlags
parameters.description: A layering flag. This parameter can be NULL if the value is not needed. The layering flag can be one or more of the following values.

functions.name: GetListBoxInfo
functions.description: Retrieves the number of items per column in a specified list box.

parameters.name: hwnd
parameters.description: A handle to the list box whose number of items per column is to be retrieved.

functions.name: GetMenu
functions.description: Retrieves a handle to the menu assigned to the specified window.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window whose menu handle is to be retrieved.

functions.name: GetMenuBarInfo
functions.description: Retrieves information about the specified menu bar.

parameters.name: hwnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window (menu bar) whose information is to be retrieved.

parameters.name: idObject
parameters.description: The menu object. This parameter can be one of the following values.

parameters.name: idItem
parameters.description: The item for which to retrieve information. If this parameter is zero, the function retrieves information about the menu itself. If this parameter is 1, the function retrieves information about the first item on the menu, and so on.

parameters.name: pmbi
parameters.description: A pointer to a MENUBARINFO structure that receives the information. Note that you must set the cbSize member to sizeof(MENUBARINFO) before calling this function.

functions.name: GetMenuCheckMarkDimensions
functions.description: Retrieves the dimensions of the default check-mark bitmap. The system displays this bitmap next to selected menu items. Before calling the SetMenuItemBitmaps function to replace the default check-mark bitmap for a menu item, an application must determine the correct bitmap size by calling GetMenuCheckMarkDimensions.

functions.name: GetMenuContextHelpId
functions.description: Retrieves the Help context identifier associated with the specified menu.

parameters.name: unnamedParam1
parameters.description: A handle to the menu for which the Help context identifier is to be retrieved.

functions.name: GetMenuDefaultItem
functions.description: Determines the default menu item on the specified menu.

parameters.name: hMenu
parameters.description: A handle to the menu for which to retrieve the default menu item.

parameters.name: fByPos
parameters.description: Indicates whether to retrieve the menu item's identifier or its position. If this parameter is FALSE, the identifier is returned. Otherwise, the position is returned.

parameters.name: gmdiFlags
parameters.description: Indicates how the function should search for menu items. This parameter can be zero or more of the following values.

functions.name: GetMenuInfo
functions.description: Retrieves information about a specified menu.

parameters.name: unnamedParam1
parameters.description: A handle on a menu.

parameters.name: unnamedParam2
parameters.description: A pointer to a MENUINFO structure containing information for the menu. Note that you must set the cbSize member to sizeof(MENUINFO) before calling this function.

functions.name: GetMenuItemCount
functions.description: Determines the number of items in the specified menu.

parameters.name: hMenu
parameters.description: A handle to the menu to be examined.

functions.name: GetMenuItemID
functions.description: Retrieves the menu item identifier of a menu item located at the specified position in a menu.

parameters.name: hMenu
parameters.description: A handle to the menu that contains the item whose identifier is to be retrieved.

parameters.name: nPos
parameters.description: The zero-based relative position of the menu item whose identifier is to be retrieved.

functions.name: GetMenuItemInfoA
functions.description: Retrieves information about a menu item.

parameters.name: hmenu
parameters.description: A handle to the menu that contains the menu item.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The identifier or position of the menu item to get information about. The meaning of this parameter depends on the value of fByPosition.

parameters.name: fByPosition
parameters.description: The meaning of uItem. If this parameter is FALSE, uItem is a menu item identifier. Otherwise, it is a menu item position. See Accessing Menu Items Programmatically for more information.

parameters.name: lpmii
parameters.description: A pointer to a MENUITEMINFO structure that specifies the information to retrieve and receives information about the menu item. Note that you must set the cbSize member to sizeof(MENUITEMINFO) before calling this function.

functions.name: GetMenuItemInfoW
functions.description: Retrieves information about a menu item.

parameters.name: hmenu
parameters.description: A handle to the menu that contains the menu item.

parameters.name: item
parameters.description: The identifier or position of the menu item to get information about. The meaning of this parameter depends on the value of fByPosition.

parameters.name: fByPosition
parameters.description: The meaning of uItem. If this parameter is FALSE, uItem is a menu item identifier. Otherwise, it is a menu item position. See Accessing Menu Items Programmatically for more information.

parameters.name: lpmii
parameters.description: A pointer to a MENUITEMINFO structure that specifies the information to retrieve and receives information about the menu item. Note that you must set the cbSize member to sizeof(MENUITEMINFO) before calling this function.

functions.name: GetMenuItemRect
functions.description:
Retrieves the bounding rectangle
for the specified menu item.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window containing the menu.

functions.name: GetMenuState
functions.description: Retrieves the menu flags associated with the specified menu item. If the menu item opens a submenu, this function also returns the number of items in the submenu.

parameters.name: hMenu
parameters.description: A handle to the menu that contains the menu item whose flags are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: uId
parameters.description: The menu item for which the menu flags are to be retrieved, as determined by the uFlags parameter.

parameters.name: uFlags
parameters.description: Indicates how the uId parameter is interpreted. This parameter can be one of the following values.

functions.name: GetMenuStringA
functions.description: Copies the text string of the specified menu item into the specified buffer.

parameters.name: hMenu
parameters.description: A handle to the menu.

parameters.name: uIDItem
parameters.description: The menu item to be changed, as determined by the uFlag parameter.

parameters.name: lpString
parameters.description: The buffer that receives the null-terminated string. If the string is as long or longer than lpString, the string is truncated and the terminating null character is added. If lpString is NULL, the function returns the length of the menu string.

parameters.name: cchMax
parameters.description: The maximum length, in characters, of the string to be copied. If the string is longer than the maximum specified in the nMaxCount parameter, the extra characters are truncated. If nMaxCount is 0, the function returns the length of the menu string.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: Indicates how the uIDItem parameter is interpreted. This parameter must be one of the following values.

functions.name: GetMenuStringW
functions.description: Copies the text string of the specified menu item into the specified buffer.

parameters.name: hMenu
parameters.description: A handle to the menu.

parameters.name: uIDItem
parameters.description: The menu item to be changed, as determined by the uFlag parameter.

parameters.name: lpString
parameters.description: The buffer that receives the null-terminated string. If the string is as long or longer than lpString, the string is truncated and the terminating null character is added. If lpString is NULL, the function returns the length of the menu string.

parameters.name: cchMax
parameters.description: The maximum length, in characters, of the string to be copied. If the string is longer than the maximum specified in the nMaxCount parameter, the extra characters are truncated. If nMaxCount is 0, the function returns the length of the menu string.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: Indicates how the uIDItem parameter is interpreted. This parameter must be one of the following values.

functions.name: GetMessage
functions.description: Retrieves a message from the calling thread's message queue. The function dispatches incoming sent messages until a posted message is available for retrieval.

parameters.name: lpMsg
parameters.description: A pointer to an MSG structure that receives message information from the thread's message queue.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window whose messages are to be retrieved. The window must belong to the current thread.

functions.name: GetMessageA
functions.description: Retrieves a message from the calling thread's message queue. The function dispatches incoming sent messages until a posted message is available for retrieval.

parameters.name: lpMsg
parameters.description: A pointer to an MSG structure that receives message information from the thread's message queue.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window whose messages are to be retrieved. The window must belong to the current thread.

functions.name: GetMessageExtraInfo
functions.description: Retrieves the extra message information for the current thread. Extra message information is an application- or driver-defined value associated with the current thread's message queue.

functions.name: GetMessagePos
functions.description: Retrieves the cursor position for the last message retrieved by the GetMessage function.

functions.name: GetMessageTime
functions.description: Retrieves the message time for the last message retrieved by the GetMessage function. The time is a long integer that specifies the elapsed time, in milliseconds, from the time the system was started to the time the message was created (that is, placed in the thread's message queue).

functions.name: GetMessageW
functions.description: Retrieves a message from the calling thread's message queue. The function dispatches incoming sent messages until a posted message is available for retrieval.

parameters.name: lpMsg
parameters.description: A pointer to an MSG structure that receives message information from the thread's message queue.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window whose messages are to be retrieved. The window must belong to the current thread.

functions.name: GetMonitorInfoA
functions.description: The GetMonitorInfo function retrieves information about a display monitor.

parameters.name: hMonitor
parameters.description: A handle to the display monitor of interest.

parameters.name: lpmi
parameters.description: A pointer to a MONITORINFO or MONITORINFOEX structure that receives information about the specified display monitor.

functions.name: GetMonitorInfoW
functions.description: The GetMonitorInfo function retrieves information about a display monitor.

parameters.name: hMonitor
parameters.description: A handle to the display monitor of interest.

parameters.name: lpmi
parameters.description: A pointer to a MONITORINFO or MONITORINFOEX structure that receives information about the specified display monitor.

functions.name: GetMouseMovePointsEx
functions.description: Retrieves a history of up to 64 previous coordinates of the mouse or pen.

parameters.name: cbSize
parameters.description: The size, in bytes, of the MOUSEMOVEPOINT structure.

parameters.name: lppt
parameters.description: A pointer to a MOUSEMOVEPOINT structure containing valid mouse coordinates (in screen coordinates). It may also contain a time stamp.

functions.name: GetNextDlgGroupItem
functions.description: Retrieves a handle to the first control in a group of controls that precedes (or follows) the specified control in a dialog box.

parameters.name: hDlg
parameters.description: A handle to the dialog box to be searched.

parameters.name: hCtl
parameters.description: A handle to the control to be used as the starting point for the search. If this parameter is NULL, the function uses the last (or first) control in the dialog box as the starting point for the search.

parameters.name: bPrevious
parameters.description: Indicates how the function is to search the group of controls in the dialog box. If this parameter is TRUE, the function searches for the previous control in the group. If it is FALSE, the function searches for the next control in the group.

functions.name: GetNextDlgTabItem
functions.description:
Retrieves a handle to the first
control that has the WS_TABSTOP
style that precedes (or follows) the specified control.

parameters.name: hDlg
parameters.description: A handle to the dialog box to be searched.

parameters.name: hCtl
parameters.description:
A handle to the control to be used as the starting point for the search.
If this parameter is NULL, the function fails.

parameters.name: bPrevious
parameters.description:
Indicates how the function is to search the dialog box. If this parameter
is TRUE, the function searches for the previous control
in the dialog box. If this parameter is FALSE, the function searches
for the next control in the dialog box.

functions.name: GetNextWindow
functions.description: Retrieves a handle to the next or previous window in the Z-Order. The next window is below the specified window; the previous window is above.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to a window. The window handle retrieved is relative to this window, based on the value of the wCmd parameter.

parameters.name: wCmd
parameters.description: Indicates whether the function returns a handle to the next window or the previous window. This parameter can be either of the following values.

functions.name: GetOpenClipboardWindow
functions.description: Retrieves the handle to the window that currently has the clipboard open.

functions.name: GetParent
functions.description: Retrieves a handle to the specified window's parent or owner.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window whose parent window handle is to be retrieved.

functions.name: GetPhysicalCursorPos
functions.description: Retrieves the position of the cursor in physical coordinates.

parameters.name: lpPoint
parameters.description: The position of the cursor, in physical coordinates.

functions.name: GetPointerCursorId
functions.description: Retrieves the cursor identifier associated with the specified pointer.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve the cursor identifier.

parameters.name: cursorId
parameters.description: An address of a UINT32 to receive the tablet cursor identifier, if any, associated with the specified pointer.

functions.name: GetPointerDevice
functions.description: Gets information about the pointer device.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: The handle to the device.

parameters.name: pointerDevice
parameters.description: A POINTER_DEVICE_INFO structure that contains information about the pointer device.

functions.name: GetPointerDeviceCursors
functions.description: Gets the cursor IDs that are mapped to the cursors associated with a pointer device.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: The device handle.

parameters.name: cursorCount
parameters.description: The number of cursors associated with the pointer device.

parameters.name: deviceCursors
parameters.description: An array of POINTER_DEVICE_CURSOR_INFO structures that contain info about the cursors. If NULL, cursorCount returns the number of cursors associated with the pointer device.

functions.name: GetPointerDeviceProperties
functions.description: Gets  device properties that aren't included in the POINTER_DEVICE_INFO structure.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: The pointer device to query properties from.

functions.name: GetPointerDeviceRects
functions.description: Gets the x and y range for the pointer device (in himetric) and the x and y range (current resolution) for the display that the pointer device is mapped to.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: The handle to the pointer device.

parameters.name: pointerDeviceRect
parameters.description: The structure for retrieving the device's physical range data.

parameters.name: displayRect
parameters.description: The structure for retrieving the display resolution.

functions.name: GetPointerDevices
functions.description: Gets information about the pointer devices attached to the system.

parameters.name: deviceCount
parameters.description: If pointerDevices is NULL, deviceCount returns the total number of attached pointer devices. Otherwise, deviceCount specifies the number of POINTER_DEVICE_INFO structures pointed to by pointerDevices.

parameters.name: pointerDevices
parameters.description: Array of POINTER_DEVICE_INFO structures for the pointer devices attached to the system. If NULL, the total number of attached pointer devices is returned in deviceCount.

functions.name: GetPointerFrameInfo
functions.description: Gets the entire frame of information for the specified pointers associated with the current message.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve frame information.

parameters.name: pointerCount
parameters.description: A pointer to a variable that specifies the count of structures in the buffer to which pointerInfo points. If GetPointerFrameInfo succeeds, pointerCount is updated with the total count of pointers in the frame.

parameters.name: pointerInfo
parameters.description: Address of an array of POINTER_INFO structures to receive the pointer information. This parameter can be NULL if *pointerCount is zero.

functions.name: GetPointerFrameInfoHistory
functions.description: Gets the entire frame of information (including coalesced input frames) for the specified pointers associated with the current message.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve frame information.

parameters.name: entriesCount
parameters.description: A pointer to a variable that specifies the count of rows in the two-dimensional array to which pointerInfo points. If GetPointerFrameInfoHistory succeeds, entriesCount is updated with the total count of frames available in the history.

parameters.name: pointerCount
parameters.description: A pointer to a variable that specifies the count of columns in the two-dimensional array to which pointerInfo points. If GetPointerFrameInfoHistory succeeds, pointerCount is updated with the total count of pointers in each frame.

parameters.name: pointerInfo
parameters.description: Address of a two-dimensional array of POINTER_INFO structures to receive the pointer information. This parameter can be NULL if *entriesCount and *pointerCount are both zero.

parameters.name: This array is interpreted as POINTER_INFO[*entriesCount][*pointerCount].
parameters.description: If the function succeeds, the return value is non-zero.

functions.name: GetPointerFramePenInfo
functions.description: Gets the entire frame of pen-based information for the specified pointers (of type PT_PEN) associated with the current message.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve frame information.

parameters.name: pointerCount
parameters.description: A pointer to a variable that specifies the count of structures in the buffer to which penInfo points. If GetPointerFramePenInfo succeeds, pointerCount  is updated with the total count of pointers in the frame.

parameters.name: penInfo
parameters.description: Address of an array of POINTER_PEN_INFO structures to receive the pointer information. This parameter can be NULL if *pointerCount is zero.

functions.name: GetPointerFramePenInfoHistory
functions.description: Gets the entire frame of pen-based information (including coalesced input frames) for the specified pointers (of type PT_PEN) associated with the current message.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: The identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve frame information.

parameters.name: entriesCount
parameters.description: A pointer to a variable that specifies the count of rows in the two-dimensional array to which penInfo points. If GetPointerFramePenInfoHistory succeeds,  entriesCount is updated with the total count of frames available in the history.

parameters.name: pointerCount
parameters.description: A pointer to a variaable that specifies the count of columns in the two-dimensional array to which penInfo points. If GetPointerFramePenInfoHistory succeeds, pointerCount is updated with  the total count of pointers in each frame.

parameters.name: penInfo
parameters.description: Address of a two-dimensional array of POINTER_PEN_INFO structures to receive the pointer information. This parameter can be NULL if *entriesCount and *pointerCount are both zero.

functions.name: GetPointerFrameTouchInfo
functions.description: Gets the entire frame of touch-based information for the specified pointers (of type PT_TOUCH) associated with the current message.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve frame information.

parameters.name: pointerCount
parameters.description: A pointer to a variable that specifies the count of structures in the buffer to which touchInfo points. If GetPointerFrameTouchInfo succeeds, pointerCount is updated with the total count of pointers in the frame.

parameters.name: touchInfo
parameters.description: Address of an array of POINTER_TOUCH_INFO structures to receive the pointer information. This parameter can be NULL if *pointerCount is zero.

functions.name: GetPointerFrameTouchInfoHistory
functions.description: Gets the entire frame of touch-based information (including coalesced input frames) for the specified pointers (of type PT_TOUCH) associated with the current message.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve frame information.

parameters.name: entriesCount
parameters.description: A pointer to variable that specifies the count of rows in the two-dimensional array to which touchInfo points. If GetPointerFrameTouchInfoHistory succeeds,  entriesCount is updated with the total count of frames available in the history.

parameters.name: pointerCount
parameters.description: A pointer to a variable that specifies the count of columns in the two-dimensional array to which touchInfo points. If GetPointerFrameTouchInfoHistory succeeds, pointerCount is updated with the total count of pointers in each frame.

parameters.name: touchInfo
parameters.description: Address of a two-dimensional array of POINTER_TOUCH_INFO structures to receive the pointer information. This parameter can be NULL if *entriesCount and *pointerCount are both zero.

parameters.name: This array is interpreted as POINTER_TOUCH_INFO[*entriesCount][*pointerCount].
parameters.description: If the function succeeds, the return value is non-zero.

functions.name: GetPointerInfo
functions.description: Gets the information for the specified pointer associated with the current message.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: The pointer identifier.

parameters.name: pointerInfo
parameters.description: Address of a  POINTER_INFO structure that receives the pointer information.

functions.name: GetPointerInfoHistory
functions.description: Gets the information associated with the individual inputs, if any, that were coalesced into the current message for the specified pointer. The most recent input is included in the returned history and is the same as the most recent input returned by the GetPointerInfo function.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve information.

parameters.name: entriesCount
parameters.description: A pointer to a variable that specifies the count of structures in the buffer to which pointerInfo points. If GetPointerInfoHistory succceeds, entriesCount  is updated with the total count of structures available. The total count of structures available is the same as the historyCount field of the POINTER_INFO structure returned by a call to GetPointerInfo.

parameters.name: pointerInfo
parameters.description: Address of an array of POINTER_INFO structures to receive the pointer information. This parameter can be NULL if *entriesCount is zero.

functions.name: GetPointerInputTransform
functions.description: Gets one or more transforms for the pointer information coordinates associated with the current message.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve information.

parameters.name: historyCount
parameters.description: The number of INPUT_TRANSFORM structures that inputTransform can point to.

functions.name: GetPointerPenInfo
functions.description: Gets the pen-based information for the specified pointer (of type PT_PEN) associated with the current message.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve information.

parameters.name: penInfo
parameters.description: Address of a POINTER_PEN_INFO structure to receive the pen-specific pointer information.

functions.name: GetPointerPenInfoHistory
functions.description:
Gets the pen-based information associated with the individual inputs, if any, that were coalesced into
the current message for the specified pointer (of type
PT_PEN). The most recent input is included in
the returned history and is the same as the most recent input returned by the
GetPointerPenInfo function.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve information.

parameters.name: entriesCount
parameters.description:
A pointer to a variable that specifies the count of structures in the buffer to which
penInfo points. If
GetPointerPenInfoHistory succeeds,
entriesCount is updated with the total count of structures available. The total
count of structures available is the same as the historyCount field in the
POINTER_PEN_INFO structure returned by a
call to  GetPointerPenInfo.

parameters.name: penInfo
parameters.description:
Address of an array of
POINTER_PEN_INFO structures to receive
the pointer information. This parameter can be NULL if *entriesCount is zero.

functions.name: GetPointerTouchInfo
functions.description: Gets the touch-based information for the specified pointer (of type PT_TOUCH) associated with the current message.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve information.

parameters.name: touchInfo
parameters.description: Address of a POINTER_TOUCH_INFO structure to receive the touch-specific pointer information.

functions.name: GetPointerTouchInfoHistory
functions.description: Gets the touch-based information associated with the individual inputs, if any, that were coalesced into the current message for the specified pointer (of type PT_TOUCH). The most recent input is included in the returned history and is the same as the most recent input returned by the GetPointerTouchInfo function.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve information.

parameters.name: entriesCount
parameters.description: A pointer to a variable that specifies the count of structures in the buffer to which touchInfo points. If GetPointerTouchInfoHistory succeeds, entriesCount is updated with the total count of structures available. The total count of structures available is the same as the historyCount field in the POINTER_INFO structure returned by a call to GetPointerInfo or GetPointerTouchInfo.

parameters.name: touchInfo
parameters.description: Address of an array of POINTER_TOUCH_INFO structures to receive the pointer information. This parameter can be NULL if *entriesCount is zero.

functions.name: GetPointerType
functions.description: Retrieves the pointer type for a specified pointer.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve pointer type.

parameters.name: pointerType
parameters.description: An address of a POINTER_INPUT_TYPE type to receive a pointer input type.

functions.name: GetPriorityClipboardFormat
functions.description: Retrieves the first available clipboard format in the specified list.

parameters.name: paFormatPriorityList
parameters.description: The clipboard formats, in priority order. For a description of the standard clipboard formats, see Standard Clipboard Formats .

parameters.name: cFormats
parameters.description:
The number of entries in the
paFormatPriorityList array. This value must not be greater than the number of entries in the list.

functions.name: GetProcessDefaultLayout
functions.description: Retrieves the default layout that is used when windows are created with no parent or owner.

parameters.name: pdwDefaultLayout
parameters.description: The current default process layout. For a list of values, see SetProcessDefaultLayout.

functions.name: GetProcessWindowStation
functions.description: Retrieves a handle to the current window station for the calling process.

functions.name: GetPropA
functions.description: Retrieves a data handle from the property list of the specified window. The character string identifies the handle to be retrieved. The string and handle must have been added to the property list by a previous call to the SetProp function.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window whose property list is to be searched.

parameters.name: lpString
parameters.description: An atom that identifies a string. If this parameter is an atom, it must have been created by using the GlobalAddAtom function. The atom, a 16-bit value, must be placed in the low-order word of the lpString parameter; the high-order word must be zero.

functions.name: GetPropW
functions.description: Retrieves a data handle from the property list of the specified window. The character string identifies the handle to be retrieved. The string and handle must have been added to the property list by a previous call to the SetProp function.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window whose property list is to be searched.

parameters.name: lpString
parameters.description: An atom that identifies a string. If this parameter is an atom, it must have been created by using the GlobalAddAtom function. The atom, a 16-bit value, must be placed in the low-order word of the lpString parameter; the high-order word must be zero.

functions.name: GetQueueStatus
functions.description: Retrieves the type of messages found in the calling thread's message queue.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: The types of messages for which to check. This parameter can be one or more of the following values.

functions.name: GetRawInputBuffer
functions.description: Performs a buffered read of the raw input messages data found in the calling thread's message queue.

parameters.name: pData
parameters.description: A pointer to a buffer of RAWINPUT structures that contain the raw input data. If NULL, size of the first raw input message data (minimum required buffer), in bytes, is returned in *pcbSize.

parameters.name: pcbSize
parameters.description: The size, in bytes, of the provided RAWINPUT buffer.

parameters.name: cbSizeHeader
parameters.description: The size, in bytes, of the RAWINPUTHEADER structure.

functions.name: GetRawInputData
functions.description: Retrieves the raw input from the specified device.

parameters.name: hRawInput
parameters.description:
A handle to the RAWINPUT structure. This comes from the
lParam in WM_INPUT.

parameters.name: uiCommand
parameters.description: The command flag. This parameter can be one of the following values.

parameters.name: pData
parameters.description:
A pointer to the data that comes from the RAWINPUT structure. This depends on the value of
uiCommand. If
pData is NULL, the required size of the buffer is returned in *pcbSize.

parameters.name: pcbSize
parameters.description:
The size, in bytes, of the data in
pData.

parameters.name: cbSizeHeader
parameters.description: The size, in bytes, of the RAWINPUTHEADER structure.

functions.name: GetRawInputDeviceInfoA
functions.description: Retrieves information about the raw input device.

parameters.name: hDevice
parameters.description: A handle to the raw input device. This comes from the hDevice member of RAWINPUTHEADER or from GetRawInputDeviceList.

parameters.name: uiCommand
parameters.description: Specifies what data will be returned in pData. This parameter can be one of the following values.

parameters.name: pData
parameters.description: A pointer to a buffer that contains the information specified by uiCommand.

parameters.name: If uiCommand is RIDI_DEVICEINFO, set the cbSize member of RID_DEVICE_INFO to sizeof(RID_DEVICE_INFO) before calling GetRawInputDeviceInfo.
parameters.description: pcbSize

functions.name: GetRawInputDeviceInfoW
functions.description: Retrieves information about the raw input device.

parameters.name: hDevice
parameters.description: A handle to the raw input device. This comes from the hDevice member of RAWINPUTHEADER or from GetRawInputDeviceList.

parameters.name: uiCommand
parameters.description: Specifies what data will be returned in pData. This parameter can be one of the following values.

parameters.name: pData
parameters.description: A pointer to a buffer that contains the information specified by uiCommand.

parameters.name: If uiCommand is RIDI_DEVICEINFO, set the cbSize member of RID_DEVICE_INFO to sizeof(RID_DEVICE_INFO) before calling GetRawInputDeviceInfo.
parameters.description: pcbSize

functions.name: GetRawInputDeviceList
functions.description: Enumerates the raw input devices attached to the system.

parameters.name: pRawInputDeviceList
parameters.description: An array of RAWINPUTDEVICELIST structures for the devices attached to the system. If NULL, the number of devices are returned in *puiNumDevices.

parameters.name: puiNumDevices
parameters.description: If pRawInputDeviceList is NULL, the function populates this variable with the number of devices attached to the system; otherwise, this variable specifies the number of RAWINPUTDEVICELIST structures that can be contained in the buffer to which pRawInputDeviceList points. If this value is less than the number of devices attached to the system, the function returns the actual number of devices in this variable and fails with ERROR_INSUFFICIENT_BUFFER.

parameters.name: cbSize
parameters.description: The size of a RAWINPUTDEVICELIST structure, in bytes.

functions.name: GetRawPointerDeviceData
functions.description: Gets the raw input data  from the pointer device.

parameters.name: pointerId
parameters.description: An identifier of the pointer for which to retrieve information.

parameters.name: historyCount
parameters.description: The pointer history.

parameters.name: propertiesCount
parameters.description: Number of properties to retrieve.

parameters.name: pProperties
parameters.description: Array of POINTER_DEVICE_PROPERTY structures that contain raw data reported by the device.

parameters.name: pValues
parameters.description: The values for pProperties.

functions.name: GetRegisteredRawInputDevices
functions.description: Retrieves the information about the raw input devices for the current application.

parameters.name: pRawInputDevices
parameters.description: An array of RAWINPUTDEVICE structures for the application.

parameters.name: puiNumDevices
parameters.description: The number of RAWINPUTDEVICE structures in *pRawInputDevices.

parameters.name: cbSize
parameters.description: The size, in bytes, of a RAWINPUTDEVICE structure.

functions.name: GetScrollBarInfo
functions.description: The GetScrollBarInfo function retrieves information about the specified scroll bar.

parameters.name: hwnd
parameters.description:
Handle to a window associated with the scroll bar whose information is to be retrieved. If the
idObject parameter is OBJID_CLIENT,
hwnd is a handle to a scroll bar control. Otherwise,
hwnd is a handle to a window created with WS_VSCROLL and/or WS_HSCROLL style.

parameters.name: idObject
parameters.description: Specifies the scroll bar object. This parameter can be one of the following values.

parameters.name: psbi
parameters.description:
Pointer to a SCROLLBARINFO structure to receive the information. Before calling GetScrollBarInfo, set the
cbSize member to
sizeof(SCROLLBARINFO).

functions.name: GetScrollInfo
functions.description: The GetScrollInfo function retrieves the parameters of a scroll bar, including the minimum and maximum scrolling positions, the page size, and the position of the scroll box (thumb).

parameters.name: hwnd
parameters.description:
Handle to a scroll bar control or a window with a standard scroll bar, depending on the value of the
fnBar parameter.

parameters.name: nBar
parameters.description: Specifies the type of scroll bar for which to retrieve parameters. This parameter can be one of the following values.

parameters.name: lpsi
parameters.description:
Pointer to a SCROLLINFO structure. Before calling GetScrollInfo, set the
cbSize member to
sizeof(SCROLLINFO), and set the
fMask member to specify the scroll bar parameters to retrieve. Before returning, the function copies the specified parameters to the appropriate members of the structure.

functions.name: GetScrollPos
functions.description: The GetScrollPos function retrieves the current position of the scroll box (thumb) in the specified scroll bar. The current position is a relative value that depends on the current scrolling range. For example, if the scrolling range is 0 through 100 and the scroll box is in the middle of the bar, the current position is 50.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description:
Handle to a scroll bar control or a window with a standard scroll bar, depending on the value of the
nBar parameter.

parameters.name: nBar
parameters.description: Specifies the scroll bar to be examined. This parameter can be one of the following values.

functions.name: GetScrollRange
functions.description: The GetScrollRange function retrieves the current minimum and maximum scroll box (thumb) positions for the specified scroll bar.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description:
Handle to a scroll bar control or a window with a standard scroll bar, depending on the value of the
nBar parameter.

parameters.name: nBar
parameters.description: Specifies the scroll bar from which the positions are retrieved. This parameter can be one of the following values.

parameters.name: lpMinPos
parameters.description: Pointer to the integer variable that receives the minimum position.

parameters.name: lpMaxPos
parameters.description: Pointer to the integer variable that receives the maximum position.

functions.name: GetShellWindow
functions.description: Retrieves a handle to the Shell's desktop window.

functions.name: GetSubMenu
functions.description: Retrieves a handle to the drop-down menu or submenu activated by the specified menu item.

parameters.name: hMenu
parameters.description: A handle to the menu.

parameters.name: nPos
parameters.description: The zero-based relative position in the specified menu of an item that activates a drop-down menu or submenu.

functions.name: GetSysColor
functions.description: Retrieves the current color of the specified display element. Display elements are the parts of a window and the display that appear on the system display screen.

parameters.name: nIndex
parameters.description: The display element whose color is to be retrieved. This parameter can be one of the following values.

functions.name: GetSysColorBrush
functions.description: The GetSysColorBrush function retrieves a handle identifying a logical brush that corresponds to the specified color index.

parameters.name: nIndex
parameters.description: A color index. This value corresponds to the color used to paint one of the window elements. See GetSysColor for system color index values.

functions.name: GetSystemDpiForProcess
functions.description: Retrieves the system DPI associated with a given process. This is useful for avoiding compatibility issues that arise from sharing DPI-sensitive information between multiple system-aware processes with different system DPI values.

parameters.name: hProcess
parameters.description: The handle for the process to examine. If this value is null, this API behaves identically to GetDpiForSystem.

functions.name: GetSystemMenu
functions.description: Enables the application to access the window menu (also known as the system menu or the control menu) for copying and modifying.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window that will own a copy of the window menu.

parameters.name: bRevert
parameters.description: The action to be taken. If this parameter is FALSE, GetSystemMenu returns a handle to the copy of the window menu currently in use. The copy is initially identical to the window menu, but it can be modified. If this parameter is TRUE, GetSystemMenu resets the window menu back to the default state. The previous window menu, if any, is destroyed.

functions.name: GetSystemMetrics
functions.description:
Retrieves the specified
system metric or system configuration setting.

parameters.name: nIndex
parameters.description:
The system metric or configuration setting to be retrieved. This parameter can be one of the following values.
Note that all SM_CX* values are widths and all SM_CY* values are heights. Also note that all settings
designed to return Boolean data represent TRUE as any nonzero value, and FALSE as a zero value.

functions.name: GetSystemMetricsForDpi
functions.description: Retrieves the specified system metric or system configuration setting taking into account a provided DPI.

parameters.name: nIndex
parameters.description: The system metric or configuration setting to be retrieved. See GetSystemMetrics for the possible values.

parameters.name: dpi
parameters.description: The DPI to use for scaling the metric.

functions.name: GetTabbedTextExtentA
functions.description: The GetTabbedTextExtent function computes the width and height of a character string. If the string contains one or more tab characters, the width of the string is based upon the specified tab stops. The GetTabbedTextExtent function uses the currently selected font to compute the dimensions of the string.

parameters.name: hdc
parameters.description: A handle to the device context.

parameters.name: lpString
parameters.description: A pointer to a character string.

parameters.name: chCount
parameters.description: The length of the text string. For the ANSI function it is a BYTE count and for the Unicode function it is a WORD count. Note that for the ANSI function, characters in SBCS code pages take one byte each, while most characters in DBCS code pages take two bytes; for the Unicode function, most currently defined Unicode characters (those in the Basic Multilingual Plane (BMP)) are one WORD while Unicode surrogates are two WORDs.

parameters.name: nTabPositions
parameters.description: The number of tab-stop positions in the array pointed to by the lpnTabStopPositions parameter.

parameters.name: lpnTabStopPositions
parameters.description: A pointer to an array containing the tab-stop positions, in device units. The tab stops must be sorted in increasing order; the smallest x-value should be the first item in the array.

functions.name: GetTabbedTextExtentW
functions.description: The GetTabbedTextExtent function computes the width and height of a character string. If the string contains one or more tab characters, the width of the string is based upon the specified tab stops. The GetTabbedTextExtent function uses the currently selected font to compute the dimensions of the string.

parameters.name: hdc
parameters.description: A handle to the device context.

parameters.name: lpString
parameters.description: A pointer to a character string.

parameters.name: chCount
parameters.description: The length of the text string. For the ANSI function it is a BYTE count and for the Unicode function it is a WORD count. Note that for the ANSI function, characters in SBCS code pages take one byte each, while most characters in DBCS code pages take two bytes; for the Unicode function, most currently defined Unicode characters (those in the Basic Multilingual Plane (BMP)) are one WORD while Unicode surrogates are two WORDs.

parameters.name: nTabPositions
parameters.description: The number of tab-stop positions in the array pointed to by the lpnTabStopPositions parameter.

parameters.name: lpnTabStopPositions
parameters.description: A pointer to an array containing the tab-stop positions, in device units. The tab stops must be sorted in increasing order; the smallest x-value should be the first item in the array.

functions.name: GetThreadDesktop
functions.description: Retrieves a handle to the desktop assigned to the specified thread.

parameters.name: dwThreadId
parameters.description:
The thread identifier. The
GetCurrentThreadId and
CreateProcess functions return thread identifiers.

functions.name: GetThreadDpiAwarenessContext
functions.description: Gets the DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT for the current thread.

functions.name: GetThreadDpiHostingBehavior
functions.description: Retrieves the DPI_HOSTING_BEHAVIOR from the current thread.

functions.name: GetTitleBarInfo
functions.description: Retrieves information about the specified title bar.

parameters.name: hwnd
parameters.description: A handle to the title bar whose information is to be retrieved.

parameters.name: pti
parameters.description: A pointer to a TITLEBARINFO structure to receive the information. Note that you must set the cbSize member to sizeof(TITLEBARINFO) before calling this function.

functions.name: GetTopWindow
functions.description: Examines the Z order of the child windows associated with the specified parent window and retrieves a handle to the child window at the top of the Z order.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the parent window whose child windows are to be examined. If this parameter is NULL, the function returns a handle to the window at the top of the Z order.

functions.name: GetTouchInputInfo
functions.description: Retrieves detailed information about touch inputs associated with a particular touch input handle.

parameters.name: hTouchInput
parameters.description: The touch input handle received in the LPARAM of a touch message. The function fails with ERROR_INVALID_HANDLE if this handle is not valid. Note that the handle is not valid after it has been used in a successful call to CloseTouchInputHandle or after it has been passed to DefWindowProc, PostMessage, SendMessage or one of their variants.

parameters.name: cInputs
parameters.description: The number of structures in the pInputs array. This should ideally be at least equal to the number of touch points associated with the message as indicated in the message WPARAM. If cInputs is less than the number of touch points, the function will still succeed and populate the pInputs buffer with information about cInputs touch points.

parameters.name: pInputs
parameters.description: A pointer to an array of TOUCHINPUT structures to receive information about the touch points associated with the specified touch input handle.

parameters.name: cbSize
parameters.description: The size, in bytes, of a single TOUCHINPUT structure. If cbSize is not the size of a single TOUCHINPUT structure, the function fails with ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER.

functions.name: GetUnpredictedMessagePos
functions.description: Gets pointer data before it has gone through touch prediction processing.

functions.name: GetUpdatedClipboardFormats
functions.description: Retrieves the currently supported clipboard formats.

parameters.name: lpuiFormats
parameters.description: An array of clipboard formats. For a description of the standard clipboard formats, see Standard Clipboard Formats.

parameters.name: cFormats
parameters.description: The number of entries in the array pointed to by lpuiFormats.

parameters.name: pcFormatsOut
parameters.description: The actual number of clipboard formats in the array pointed to by lpuiFormats.

functions.name: GetUpdateRect
functions.description: The GetUpdateRect function retrieves the coordinates of the smallest rectangle that completely encloses the update region of the specified window. GetUpdateRect retrieves the rectangle in logical coordinates. If there is no update region, GetUpdateRect retrieves an empty rectangle (sets all coordinates to zero).

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: Handle to the window whose update region is to be retrieved.

parameters.name: lpRect
parameters.description: Pointer to the RECT structure that receives the coordinates, in device units, of the enclosing rectangle.

functions.name: GetUpdateRgn
functions.description: The GetUpdateRgn function retrieves the update region of a window by copying it into the specified region. The coordinates of the update region are relative to the upper-left corner of the window (that is, they are client coordinates).

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: Handle to the window with an update region that is to be retrieved.

parameters.name: hRgn
parameters.description: Handle to the region to receive the update region.

parameters.name: bErase
parameters.description: Specifies whether the window background should be erased and whether nonclient areas of child windows should be drawn. If this parameter is FALSE, no drawing is done.

functions.name: GetUserObjectInformationA
functions.description: Retrieves information about the specified window station or desktop object.

parameters.name: hObj
parameters.description:
A handle to the window station or desktop object. This handle is returned by the
CreateWindowStation,
OpenWindowStation,
CreateDesktop, or
OpenDesktop function.

parameters.name: nIndex
parameters.description: The information to be retrieved. The parameter can be one of the following values.

parameters.name: pvInfo
parameters.description: A pointer to a buffer to receive the object information.

parameters.name: nLength
parameters.description: The size of the buffer pointed to by the pvInfo parameter, in bytes.

parameters.name: lpnLengthNeeded
parameters.description: A pointer to a variable receiving the number of bytes required to store the requested information. If this variable's value is greater than the value of the nLength parameter when the function returns, the function returns FALSE, and none of the information is copied to the pvInfo buffer. If the value of the variable pointed to by lpnLengthNeeded is less than or equal to the value of nLength, the entire information block is copied.

functions.name: GetUserObjectInformationW
functions.description: Retrieves information about the specified window station or desktop object.

parameters.name: hObj
parameters.description:
A handle to the window station or desktop object. This handle is returned by the
CreateWindowStation,
OpenWindowStation,
CreateDesktop, or
OpenDesktop function.

parameters.name: nIndex
parameters.description: The information to be retrieved. The parameter can be one of the following values.

parameters.name: pvInfo
parameters.description: A pointer to a buffer to receive the object information.

parameters.name: nLength
parameters.description: The size of the buffer pointed to by the pvInfo parameter, in bytes.

parameters.name: lpnLengthNeeded
parameters.description: A pointer to a variable receiving the number of bytes required to store the requested information. If this variable's value is greater than the value of the nLength parameter when the function returns, the function returns FALSE, and none of the information is copied to the pvInfo buffer. If the value of the variable pointed to by lpnLengthNeeded is less than or equal to the value of nLength, the entire information block is copied.

functions.name: GetUserObjectSecurity
functions.description: The GetUserObjectSecurity function retrieves security information for the specified user object.

parameters.name: hObj
parameters.description: A handle to the user object for which to return security information.

parameters.name: pSIRequested
parameters.description:
A pointer to a
SECURITY_INFORMATION value that specifies the security information being requested.

parameters.name: pSID
parameters.description:
A pointer to a
SECURITY_DESCRIPTOR structure in self-relative format that contains the requested information when the function returns. This buffer must be aligned on a 4-byte boundary.

parameters.name: nLength
parameters.description: The length, in bytes, of the buffer pointed to by the pSD parameter.

parameters.name: lpnLengthNeeded
parameters.description: A pointer to a variable to receive the number of bytes required to store the complete security descriptor. If this variable's value is greater than the value of the nLength parameter when the function returns, the function returns FALSE and none of the security descriptor is copied to the buffer. Otherwise, the entire security descriptor is copied.

functions.name: GetWindow
functions.description: Retrieves a handle to a window that has the specified relationship (Z-Order or owner) to the specified window.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to a window. The window handle retrieved is relative to this window, based on the value of the uCmd parameter.

parameters.name: uCmd
parameters.description: The relationship between the specified window and the window whose handle is to be retrieved. This parameter can be one of the following values.

functions.name: GetWindowContextHelpId
functions.description: Retrieves the Help context identifier, if any, associated with the specified window.

parameters.name: unnamedParam1
parameters.description: A handle to the window for which the Help context identifier is to be retrieved.

functions.name: GetWindowDC
functions.description: The GetWindowDC function retrieves the device context (DC) for the entire window, including title bar, menus, and scroll bars. A window device context permits painting anywhere in a window, because the origin of the device context is the upper-left corner of the window instead of the client area.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window with a device context that is to be retrieved. If this value is NULL, GetWindowDC retrieves the device context for the entire screen.

functions.name: GetWindowDisplayAffinity
functions.description: Retrieves the current display affinity setting, from any process, for a given window.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window.

parameters.name: pdwAffinity
parameters.description:
A pointer to a variable that receives the display affinity setting.
See SetWindowDisplayAffinity for a list of affinity settings and their meanings.

functions.name: GetWindowDpiAwarenessContext
functions.description: Returns the DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT associated with a window.

parameters.name: hwnd
parameters.description: The window to query.

functions.name: GetWindowDpiHostingBehavior
functions.description: Returns the DPI_HOSTING_BEHAVIOR of the specified window.

parameters.name: hwnd
parameters.description: The handle for the window to examine.

functions.name: GetWindowFeedbackSetting
functions.description: Retrieves the feedback configuration for a window.

parameters.name: hwnd
parameters.description: The window to check for feedback configuration.

parameters.name: feedback

functions.name: GetWindowLongA
functions.description: Retrieves information about the specified window. The function also retrieves the 32-bit (DWORD) value at the specified offset into the extra window memory. NoteÂ Â If you are retrieving a pointer or a handle, this function has been superseded by the GetWindowLongPtr function. (Pointers and handles are 32 bits on 32-bit Windows and 64 bits on 64-bit Windows.) To write code that is compatible with both 32-bit and 64-bit versions of Windows, use GetWindowLongPtr.

parameters.name: hWnd
parameters.description: A handle to the window and, indirectly, the class to which the window belongs.

parameters.name: nIndex
parameters.description: The zero-based offset to the value to be retrieved. Valid values are in the range zero through the number of bytes of extra window memory, minus four; for example, if you specified 12 or more bytes of extra memory, a value of 8 would be an index to the third 32-bit integer. To retrieve any other value, specify one of the following values.

functions.name: GrayStringA
functions.description: The GrayString function draws gray text at the specified location. The function draws the text by copying it into a memory bitmap, graying the bitmap, and then copying the bitmap to the screen. The function grays the text regardless of the selected brush and background. GrayString uses the font currently selected for the specified device context.

parameters.name: hDC
parameters.description: A handle to the device context.

parameters.name: hBrush
parameters.description: A handle to the brush to be used for graying. If this parameter is NULL, the text is grayed with the same brush that was used to draw window text.

parameters.name: lpOutputFunc
parameters.description: A pointer to the application-defined function that will draw the string, or, if TextOut is to be used to draw the string, it is a NULL pointer. For details, see the OutputProc callback function.

parameters.name: lpData
parameters.description: A pointer to data to be passed to the output function. If the lpOutputFunc parameter is NULL, lpData must be a pointer to the string to be output.

parameters.name: nCount
parameters.description: The number of characters to be output. If the nCount parameter is zero, GrayString calculates the length of the string (assuming lpData is a pointer to the string). If nCount is 1 and the function pointed to by lpOutputFunc returns FALSE, the image is shown but not grayed.

parameters.name: X
parameters.description: The device x-coordinate of the starting position of the rectangle that encloses the string.

parameters.name: Y
parameters.description: The device y-coordinate of the starting position of the rectangle that encloses the string.

parameters.name: nWidth
parameters.description: The width, in device units, of the rectangle that encloses the string. If this parameter is zero, GrayString calculates the width of the area, assuming lpData is a pointer to the string.

parameters.name: nHeight
parameters.description: The height, in device units, of the rectangle that encloses the string. If this parameter is zero, GrayString calculates the height of the area, assuming lpData is a pointer to the string.

functions.description: Adds or removes highlighting from an item in a menu bar.

functions.name: InflateRect
functions.description: The InflateRect function increases or decreases the width and height of the specified rectangle. The InflateRect function adds -dx units to the left end and dx to the right end of the rectangle and -dy units to the top and dy to the bottom. The dx and dy parameters are signed values; positive values increase the width and height, and negative values decrease them.

parameters.description: The amount to increase or decrease the rectangle width. This parameter must be negative to decrease the width.

functions.name: InternalGetWindowText
functions.description:
[This function is not intended for general
      use. It may
      be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions of Windows.]
Copies the text of the specified window's title bar (if it has one) into a buffer.
This function is similar to the GetWindowText function.
However, it obtains the window text directly from the window structure
associated with the specified window's handle and then always provides the text as a
Unicode string. This is unlike GetWindowText which obtains the
text by sending the window a WM_GETTEXT message.  If the
specified window is a control, the text of the control is obtained.
Syntax
int InternalGetWindowText(
  HWND   hWnd,
  LPWSTR pString,
  int    cchMaxCount
);

Parameters
hWnd
Type: HWND
A handle to the window or control containing the text.
pString
Type: LPWSTR
The buffer that is to receive the text.
If the string is as long or longer than the buffer, the string is truncated and terminated with a null character.
cchMaxCount
Type: int
The maximum number of characters to be copied to the buffer, including the null character. If the text exceeds this limit, it is truncated.
Return value
Type: int
If the function succeeds, the return value is the length, in characters, of the copied string, not including the terminating null character.
If the window has no title bar or text, if the title bar is empty, or if the window or control handle is invalid, the return value is zero. To get extended error information, call GetLastError.
Remarks
This function was not included in the SDK headers and libraries until WindowsÂ XP with Service PackÂ 1 (SP1) and Windows ServerÂ 2003. If you do not have a header file and import library for this function, you can call the function using LoadLibrary and GetProcAddress.
Requirements

WindowsÂ 2000 Professional [desktop apps only]


Minimum supported server
WindowsÂ 2000 Server [desktop apps only]

Windows

winuser.h (include Windows.h)

User32.lib


DLL
User32.dll
